Module it.polimi.ingsw
Package it.polimi.ingsw.model

Class DoublyLinkedList

java.lang.Object
it.polimi.ingsw.model.DoublyLinkedList
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable
public class DoublyLinkedList extends Object implements Serializable
This is the islands' data structure. It is a particular list in which the last node contains the address of the first node and the first node contains the address of the last node (so, it is "circular" and none of the pointers are set to null).
See Also:
  • Serialized Form

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    DoublyLinkedList()
    Doubly Linked List constructor (since it has been specifically written for the game, the list contains 12 nodes from the beginning, each one holding an island).

  • Constructor Details

    • DoublyLinkedList

      public DoublyLinkedList()
      Doubly Linked List constructor (since it has been specifically written for the game, the list contains 12 nodes from the beginning, each one holding an island).

  • Method Details

    • getSize

      public int getSize()
      Returns the number of nodes (islands) of the list.
      Returns:
      an int representing the number of nodes (islands) in the list.

    • getHead

      public Island getHead()
      Returns the Island in the head of the list.
      Returns:
      the Island in the head of the list.

    • addIsland

      public void addIsland(Island island)
      Adds an island at the bottom of the list. If the list is empty, adds the first element and set the "prev" and "next" pointers towards the same island.
      Parameters:
      island - the island to add.

    • mergeIslands

      public void mergeIslands(Island island)
      Merges the island passed as a parameter with one or both the adjacent islands, if requirements are met. If merging is performed, removes the adjacent islands and updates the current island with the correct numbers of towers and students.
      Parameters:
      island - the island whose merging capability is going to be checked.

    • removeIsland

      public void removeIsland(Island island)
      Removes an island and decreases the size of the data structure. If the removed node is the head node, the next island is declared the new head.
      Parameters:
      island - the island to remove.

    • getIslandFromID

      public Island getIslandFromID(int islandID) throws IslandNotFoundException
      Returns the island with the specified ID, if present.
      Parameters:
      islandID - the ID of the island to return.
      Returns:
      the desired island.
      Throws:
      IslandNotFoundException - if the provided island ID does not refer to any of the existing islands.
